messages.msgSnippet: ... I went no mail on a list a couple of days ago. It stopped pretty well right away, but the next day a blip of about 20 came through. It was weird. And
messages.messageBody:
>It sometimes takes two or three days for yahoo to stop sending mail when
>you unsubscribe. It can also take time to start getting mail when you
>first subscribe. Other times I have noticed that the changes register
>immediately.

I went no mail on a list a couple of days ago. It stopped pretty well right
away, but the next day a blip of about 20 came through. It was weird. And
during that time, Yahoo lost a bunch of my groups. They're back now. <g>
Tia

messages.subject: unsubscribe but still getting email, was Re: a reminder about this list
messages.msgSnippet: It sometimes takes two or three days for yahoo to stop sending mail when you unsubscribe.  It can also take time to start getting mail when you first
messages.messageBody:
It sometimes takes two or three days for yahoo to stop sending mail when you unsubscribe. It can also take time to start getting mail when you first subscribe. Other times I have noticed that the changes register immediately.

If you go into yahoo groups and it shows that you are not a member of a group, you will stop receiving the mail. Sooner or later...

Mary Ellen

----- Original Message -----
I have been trying to change my member profile and stop getting e-mails. I
have been trying for three days. It says that I will not receive e-mail but
it still does. Help please!

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
